meanings.definition: To make a harsh, high-pitched sound
meanings.sent1: The old door would screak loudly when opened.
meanings.sent2: I heard the rusty swing screak as the children played.
meanings.sent3: The mouse made the cheese screak as it tried to steal a piece.
meanings.sent4: The brakes on the car began to screak, signaling a need for repair.
meanings.sent5: The rusty gate would screak in protest every time it was opened.

meanings.sent1: The screak of the rusty hinges echoed through the house.
meanings.sent2: The screak of the violin filled the concert hall.
meanings.sent3: The screak of the chalk on the blackboard made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent4: The screak of the brakes startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent5: The screak of the seagulls overhead added to the coastal atmosphere.
